You guys sure have a lot to learn about common courtesy especially to the paying loyal customer. 
I've been here since season 1 and you guys want to ban my account for an honest sincere accident. 
This is exactly why Riot is known for being a bad company according to the BBB.
Even if you don't get banned for account sharing (which, to be clear, is still not actually allowed) that doesn't mean that actions done by somebody else on that account won't have consequences.

Oh, I have empathy. This situations must really suck for OP.
That doesn't change the fact that Riots needs to be able to hold **somebody** responsible for actions taken on an account. 
It also doesn't change the fact that the account already must have had other (fairly recent) punishments to be permabanned, which makes this permaban partially OP's fault; either because previous punishments were the result of OP's actions, or because OP was negligent enough to not protect his account better even after other people already previously got it punished.

Empathy or not, there's no real alternative here.
Showing leniency due to those specific circumstances would set a precedent that pretty much everybody can at least attempt to exploit, which will clog up the forums and clog up their ticketing system with pointless requests of people who are trying to get unbanned.

Edit for true-story-analogy:
I recently was caught in a subway without a ticket. I had full intention of buying a ticket for the full semester; in fact I wanted to buy it on the very same day on the return trip (I had a bit of a time issue in the morning).
I neither had bad intentions, nor did my actions result in any negative effect for anybody else (which is more than can be said about OP's situation).

But while I tried to explain what happened, I didn't complain when I didn't get any leniency. Instead I simply paid the fine. The reason being the same as in OP's situation: There simply is no alternative in handling these situations. If I was able to get away with "I wanted to buy a time ticket anyway" then **everybody** could get away with that excuse.
I have empathy for myself and I have empathy for OP. But that doesn't mean I can't be rational about it and see why the both of us needed to be punished.

But a perma ban? On a 5+ year old account? With little to none bad behavior? I literally see people telling each other to commit suicide game by game yet a small coincidental use of 3 letters gets me permabanned? How does this even remotely demonstrates justice?
